thread.title: Christophe Galtier insists his side can beat Man United | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Christophe Galtier insists his side can beat Man United | Daily Mail Online

author: Simon Peach
title: Christophe Galtier insists his side can beat Man United | Daily Mail Online
text: St Etienne boss Christophe Galtier insists deficit against Manchester United is 'not insurmountable' in Europa League return leg Manchester United cruised to comfortable 3-0 victory in Europa League first leg St Etienne have mountain to climb but Christophe Galtier believes in comeback He does not think return fixture is dead rubber but asked his side to keep cool Galtier noted: 'We have a huge but not insurmountable handicap' Published: 16:31 GMT, 21 February 2017 | Updated: 16:33 GMT, 21 February 2017 117 shares comments St Etienne coach Christophe Galtier does not believe the 3-0 loss at Manchester United is an 'insurmountable handicap' and pledged to go for the jugular in the Europa League return leg. Zlatan Ibrahimovic's hat-trick and the battle between the Pogba brothers dominated the first-leg headlines on a night when the margin of victory flattered Jose Mourinho's side. The United manager criticised his players' first-half approach as Les Verts scared the hosts on several occasions last Thursday - something Galtier is confident his side can do again. St Etienne boss Christophe Galtier insists the second leg is not a dead rubber Zlatan Ibrahimovic scored a hat-trick at Old Trafford in the first encounter between the sides The odds on St Etienne overturning the 3-0 loss and progressing from Wednesday's second leg are as long as 40-1, yet their manager has not given up hope. 'There is no need for hyper motivation,' Galtier told reporters. 'We have a huge but not insurmountable handicap. We will play in another big atmosphere. The stadium will be full. Besides, it's been nearly full since December. RELATED ARTICLES
